author: sky.cactus
content: I think the key with the current design is to just be *incredibly* careful that you don't expose your `engine_` API to the world.

author: yorickdowne
content: I think I understand that a 3rd party service with an engine API available will not be a thing. Beyond “Proof of Custody” I don’t know why, yet. Can you shed light?

author: yorickdowne
content:
Background for the question: a lot of individual stakers are using a 3rd party “eth1” service now. There’s been some cautioning messages that this will need to be run locally come merge, or alternatively that the whole enchilada needs to become 3rd party - consensus and execution both.
But the technical “and here is why” eludes me.
I’ve reached out to Infura and will hopefully have a chat with them as well re post merge plans

author: djrtwo
content:
proof of custody on execution is the answer. It is an active research and specification topic and is expected to be released as soon as possible after the merge

any service allowing outsourcing of execution between merge and then for validators is short-sighted and will result in unhappy and confused customers when they can no longer utilize it

author: djrtwo
content: it is important, imo, to make clear what the requirements of validation *will be* in the near future rather than just what they happen to be at point of merge
